availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ohio County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sally A. Hocker Tabor in Ohio County, Kentucky, on December 24, 1855. Father of John W. Tabor, Pardon W. Tabor, Mary E. Tabor Bean, and Sally A. Tabor Hartford. Farmer in Ohio County in 1850. Farmer in Ohio County in 1860. Employed John Williams and Thomas Stevens as laborers in Ohio County in 1860. Farmer in Ohio County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, District 1, p. 39B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Caney, p. 739.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Sulphur Springs, p. 515B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Ohio County, KY, July 1863, p. 453.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994051, Ohio County Marriages, p. 7.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Ohio County Wills, vol. A-D, 1801-1988, p. 419-21.
"Hartford," Owensboro Messenger (KY), May 11, 1900, Newspapers.com, https://www.newspapers.com/image/375910684/?terms=%22Pardon%20Tabor%22&match=1
